channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Harris brings a bit of Trump into her rally to try to show him as ‘unhinged’
item.description: Vice President Harris wants voters to pay more attention when Trump talks about "the enemy within." On Monday, she played a highlight reel to paint him as “increasingly unstable and unhinged.”
item.content:encoded:
Vice President Harris wants voters to pay more attention when Trump talks about "the enemy within." On Monday, she played a highlight reel to paint him as “increasingly unstable and unhinged.”

(Image credit: Dustin Franz)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Giant pandas will arrive at D.C.'s National Zoo this week
item.description: After an 11-month wait, giant pandas will populate the zoo once again. A pair of pandas, which left China on FedEx's "Panda Express" cargo jet, are expected to arrive in the D.C. area on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
After an 11-month wait, giant pandas will populate the zoo once again. A pair of pandas, which left China on FedEx's "Panda Express" cargo jet, are expected to arrive in the D.C. area on Tuesday.

(Image credit: Jacquelyn Martin)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: 6 people accuse Sean 'Diddy' Combs of sexual assault in new lawsuits
item.description: The lawsuits filed Monday accuse the hip-hop mogul of raping women, sexually assaulting men and molesting a 16-year-old boy.
item.content:encoded:
The lawsuits filed Monday accuse the hip-hop mogul of raping women, sexually assaulting men and molesting a 16-year-old boy.

(Image credit: Richard Shotwell/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Lilly Ledbetter, the activist who inspired Fair Pay Act, dies at 86
item.description: Lilly Ledbetter, a supervisor at a Goodyear tire plant in Alabama, discovered she was receiving less pay than men who worked the same position. Her case led to a monumental law on pay equity.
item.content:encoded:
Lilly Ledbetter, a supervisor at a Goodyear tire plant in Alabama, discovered she was receiving less pay than men who worked the same position. Her case led to a monumental law on pay equity.

(Image credit: Mark Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Native voters could swing Arizona. Both parties want their votes
item.description: Both Republicans and Democrats are trying to marshal Native American voters in Arizona, which could prove decisive to winning the key state.
item.content:encoded:
Both Republicans and Democrats are trying to marshal Native American voters in Arizona, which could prove decisive to winning the key state.

(Image credit: Ash Ponders for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: August 2024 Monthly Content Review Memo
item.description: A 10-person cohort met to discuss NPR's three-week run of coverage from the day of the Biden-Trump debate until the day President Biden withdrew from the 2024 presidential race.
item.content:encoded: A 10-person cohort met to discuss NPR's three-week run of coverage from the day of the Biden-Trump debate until the day President Biden withdrew from the 2024 presidential race.

item.title: In Chile a language on the verge of extinction, stirs into life
item.description: Ckunsa, an indigenous language in Chile, was declared dead 70 years ago. But groups in northern Chile are successfuly reviving the language and teaching it to a new generation.
item.content:encoded:
Ckunsa, an indigenous language in Chile, was declared dead 70 years ago. But groups in northern Chile are successfuly reviving the language and teaching it to a new generation.

(Image credit: Cristóbal Olivares for NPR)
item.dc:creator: John Bartlett

item.title: In an election race this close, Asian American voters have become a force
item.description: Asian Americans are the fastest growing-voting group in the country. That means parties are courting them in tight races in states like Pennsylvania.
item.content:encoded:
Asian Americans are the fastest growing-voting group in the country. That means parties are courting them in tight races in states like Pennsylvania.

(Image credit: Deepa Shivaram)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Nobel Prize goes to 3 economists who study the wealth and poverty of nations
item.description: The award is shared by Daron Acemoglu and Simon Johnson of MIT and James Robinson of the University of Chicago for their research on the institutional roots of national wealth and poverty. They will split the prize money of 11 million Swedish krona or about $1.058 million.
item.content:encoded:
The award is shared by Daron Acemoglu and Simon Johnson of MIT and James Robinson of the University of Chicago for their research on the institutional roots of national wealth and poverty. They will split the prize money of 11 million Swedish krona or about $1.058 million.

(Image credit: CHRISTINE OLSSON)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Highlighting Indigenous voices across NPR’s network
item.description: NPR is celebrating Indigenous Peoples' Day by acknowledging Indigenous people's accomplishments and delving into their culture and the issues they face with stories from our network.
item.content:encoded:
NPR is celebrating Indigenous Peoples' Day by acknowledging Indigenous people's accomplishments and delving into their culture and the issues they face with stories from our network.

(Image credit: Left photo: Joseph Scheller)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
